page.title: 01Religion in Staining Class 1
page.content: E St Lukes Staining St Michael and All Angels Grange Park St Mark Layton RC Marie Reparatrice St Kentigern Bpool English Martyrs Poulton Salem Methodist Layton. {Staining} {1296}Vill of Steyninges given to monks of Whalley by Earl of Lincoln. A Chantry with 2 priests on site of Staining Hall farm. {1550}Dissolution-lands to Sir Th. Holt then Singleton family. Poulton St Chads took over until 1856, meetings held in Windhoek cottage next to mill. {1865} Foundation of village church. 1/2 acre cost 20000p. Church Sunday School and Day School. {1956}Church coopted to St Michaels Grange Park. {1957}Day school became Controlled by LEA New building 1960s {1976}All children in new building. {1982}Church licenced for marriage etc and given name St Luke's. The Day School gave apse stained glass windows to mark this event.
